article.headline: Southern Miss 77, Texas Southern 63
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Jasper Johnson scored 23 points as Southern Miss beat Texas Southern 77-63 on Tuesday night. Southern Mississippi (2-0) shot 48 percent from the floor and started quickly, opening a 48-29 lead at halftime. "I thought we played a great first half," Southern Miss head coach James Green said. "We shot well, defended well and rebounded well. In the second half, (Texas Southern) beat us with the penetration, and we got a little careless with the ball." Sean Walker led Texas Southern (0-2) with 17 points and 12 rebounds. The Tigers struggled at the free-throw line, going just 18-for-32. Johnson scored 17 of his points in the first half. Charles Gaines added 17 points and 14 rebounds for the Golden Eagles, and Greg Johnson had 10 points. Larry Evans scored 13 points for the Tigers. Damien Smith added 12. The Tigers were 21-for-47 from the field. The Golden Eagles outrebounded Texas Southern 43-28.
